evidence.text: Defendants have cancelled over $900 million in contracts necessary for the maintenance and operation of data collected by IES. Defendants have also halved the Department’s overall workforce and imposed even starker layoffs at IES and NCES, shrinking IES’s workforce from over 175 to 20 employees, and NCES’s workforce from approximately 100 employees down to three.
evidence.source_document: Plaintiffs’ Memorandum of Law in Support of Their Motion for a Preliminary Injunction

evidence.text: Defendants have cancelled contracts necessary for the maintenance and functioning of several datasets relied on by Plaintiffs and their members, including: (1) contracts for the National Postsecondary Student Aid Study (NPSAS); (2) contracts necessary to the Common Core of Data (CCD); (3) surveys necessary for the completion of the congressionally required NAEP and EDFacts; (4) contracts supporting the analysis and quality assurance of NAEP data; (5) contracts supporting the operation and availability of the WWC; (6) contracts for the Trends in International Math and Science Study (TIMSS); and (7) contracts through which NCES completes congressionally-mandated longitudinal data collections.
evidence.source_document: Plaintiffs’ Memorandum of Law in Support of Their Motion for a Preliminary Injunction

add_extracted.value: Defendants cancelled over $900 million in contracts for Institute of Education Sciences (IES) data collection, reduced IES staff from 175 to 20 employees and NCES from 100 to 3, restricted access to data including pausing restricted-use data licenses, and terminated contracts for key datasets (NAEP, EDFacts, NPSAS) to hinder Plaintiffs' research on educational disparities.
